column4: FYI you usinally want to check for an EE (error) in xorg.X.log - you don't have any :|
these sort of issues (breaking from updates) is not uncommon with ubuntu.  with other distros it's unheard of...
are you logged in as root, or using sudo?
you need to use "sudo apt-get dist-upgrade" to do the same thing as the GUI update manager (it updates everything)
yea someone told me that in Pm and it worked.
remember me lol from earlier with the stupid nvidia/vga problem it was all solved by a reinstall :-P
solved by a reinstall funny, i wouldn't consider that a solution ;)  glad it's working for ya!
kernels almost always require dist-upgrade FYI

well it was the only way to get it fixed I figured, I tried alot of stuff nothing was working some kind of "ghost" was in the machine. Install was very quick and getting stuff re-setup was actually easy since I just saved all my config files like sshd_config and smb.conf etc
backing up config files is smart!  so is reinstall - if you have no other option
later today i'll make a full hd image with DD incase anything gets jacked up.
yea I tried to fix it for probably 8-10 hours over two days and reinstalled it worked out of the box :-)
waste of space to do drive imaging (that's a windows thing).  but do whatever you think best.
why is it a waste of space? one command I have a 100% backup and I can re-install the backup with one command as well.
you just proved how fast reinstall is ;)
why is it a waste of space? one command I have a 100% backup and I can re-install the backup with one command as well.
do what YOU want.  we can hold different opinions and both be right ;)
thats what big hard drives are for ;-P
my / on this machine is only 40gb its an ssd and then I got a 1TB drive for storage. this is my music/home server machine. ;-)
i run 60GB SSD (58% full), 1TB (52% full), 1TB (67% full) and 500GB (46% full).  i can fill my drives with better stuff ;)  config files take so little to backup.
yea they do and linux is awesome cause most things are controlled by one text file lol
oh how i love "config files" ;)
and the whole home directory with hidden for settings - brilliant
i have NOTHING against backups!  it's just i think drive imaging is a "waste of space"...
